message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.CYBER. 

The paper focuses on predicting whether a research work is likely to be cited in a public policy document based on its online attention, primarily on social media platforms. This involves techniques such as classification models, which are commonly used in areas such as information retrieval (cs.IR) and social media analysis (cs.SI). The paper also discusses the societal impact of research output, which is relevant to the sub-categories of social computing (cs.SOC) and cyber security (cs.CYBER). Finally, the use of online attention as a predictor could be related to the sub-category of digital libraries (cs.DL), which deals with the organization and retrieval of digital information.
